alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Blair; Cambria; Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 04 at 12:34PM EST until March 04 at 4:00PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...HIGH WIND WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...West winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...Blair, Huntingdon, Mifflin, Juniata, Fulton, Franklin, Perry, Cumberland, Adams and York Counties. * WHEN...Through 4 PM EST today. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Stronger wind gusts are possible on the ridge tops. Travel will be difficult at times, especially for high profile vehicles on north, south roads where cross winds will be the strongest.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. For high wind safety information, visit weather.gov/wind. The latest forecast information can be found on the NWS State College Facebook page and Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or on the web at weather.gov/ctp. Review wind safety and preparedness information at weather.gov/safety/wind.
